data.value: A notching comb filter is a band-stop filter with a narrow bandwidth (high quality factor). It rejects a narrow frequency band and leaves the rest of the spectrum little changed.
A peaking comb filter is a band-pass filter with a narrow bandwidth (high quality factor). It rejects components outside a narrow frequency band.

For implementation details, see . The TF implementation of the comb filter is numerically stable even at higher orders due to the use of a single repeated pole, which won't suffer from precision loss.
Frequency to attenuate (notching) or boost (peaking). If
is specified, this is in the same units as
. By default, it is a normalized scalar that must satisfy
corresponding to half of the sampling frequency.
Quality factor. Dimensionless parameter that characterizes notch filter -3 dB bandwidth
The type of comb filter generated by the function. If 'notch', then it returns a filter with notches at frequencies
, etc. If 'peak', then it returns a filter with peaks at frequencies
The sampling frequency of the signal. Default is 2.0.
is less than or equal to 0 or greater than or equal to
